item.description:
Boston Vegetarian Society

invites you to a FREE Lecture

ALL WELCOME - No RSVP needed.


Acid/AlkalineBalance:                          The Body Knows Best!
                                                         with Dorothy Torrey

Over-acidity within the body is an underlying cause of many disorders. An imbalance between acid and alkaline within your body can be associated with feeling tired, bloated, achy, and lacking energy.

An acid forming diet of meat, dairy, sweets, trans fats, chemical additives, processed foods, etc., makes it difficult for our bodies to restore balance.

“The first step to maintaining health is to alkalize the body. The cells of a healthy body are alkaline while the cells of a diseased body are acidic.” - Dr. Arthur Guyton, author of Textbook of Medical Physiology, 11th Edition.  An alkaline diet is plant-based.

In this seminar you will gain the basic understanding of acid/alkaline balance, and that health, vitality, and renewed energy begin with a balanced pH or acid/alkaline lifestyle.

BIO:
Dorothy Torrey has been an avid student of health for over 30 years.  She has been following an alkaline lifestyle for about 10 years, which started her on the road to healing.  She has addressed her diagnosis of cancer, Lyme Disease, depression, severe osteoarthritis, and hypothyroidism, using natural approaches.

She is an Acid/Alkaline Health and Food Coach educating about achieving vibrant health and wellness on Cape Cod and throughout the world.  Dorothy holds a MS degree, and is a Life Force Educator, a Certified Wellness Cuisine Coach and a Reconnective Healing Practitioner. She is also the Cape Cod Ecopolitan Coordinator for Dr.Tel-Oren lectures and other life- changing events.

Visit Dorothy's website at www.PathToVibrantHealth.com - a resource for well-being.


4 PM Seminar Description (Free) --
5:15 PM - SOCIAL DINNER (optional) - let us get to know you!

Stay and enjoy Grasshopper's delicious unlimited vegan buffet for only $10 + tax + tip
Includes appetizers, soups, salad, and numerous entrees.

LOCATION for seminar and dinner:
Grasshopper (an all-vegan restaurant)
1 North Beacon St.
Union Square, Allston (Boston)
617-254-8883
See directions below.

Evelyn Kimber
Boston Vegetarian Society
www.BostonVeg.org
Info:  617-424-8846  BVS

DIRECTIONS:

The intersection where Grasshopper is located (the intersection of Cambridge St., Brighton Ave, and North Beacon St.) is called "Union Square" in Allston.  Landmarks are the Jackson Mann School, Twin Donuts, and Grasshopper.

BY PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION --

The closest subway stop is Allston St.
(Green Line B car - Commonwealth Ave. line).
Get off there; facing outbound, take a right on Allston St.
Follow Allston St. 4/10 mile to where it ends at Brighton Ave.
Turn left (at Burger King) and walk 50 yards or so to Union Sq.
Grasshopper is on the opposite side of the square.

The #66 bus Dudley Station via Harvard St. to Union Square to Harvard Square.

The #57 bus Kenmore Station to Watertown Square, via Union Square.

The #64 bus (Oak Square -- University Park or Kendall Sq. via Central Square) also goes through Union Square.

BY CAR --

Free street parking.  Allow time to find a space.

Type in 1 North Beacon St. Boston MA 02134
http://maps.google.com/

From Mass Pike, take the Allston/Brighton exit.  (Heading east, it is Exit 18, heading west it is Exit 20.)  Follow Cambridge St. straight into Union Sq.  Grasshopper is on the right side of the big intersection.

Boston Vegetarian Society, P. O. Box 38-1071, Cambridge, MA 02238-1071
item.name: FREE Lecture: Acid/Alkaline Balance: The Body Knows Best!
